website_summaries.verdict: This model is slightly lower than the 26-inch Schwinn, allowing users to stand over the frame when not in motion.
pros: The low-to-the-ground setup makes this an excellent choice for shorter riders
The smaller design also makes this trike possible to transport, though you will still need a truck or an SUV
Single speed with front and rear brakes

customer_reviews.title: This bike is perfect for him
customer_reviews.text: We bought this bike for our 9 year old son who has autism. Riding a regular bike is a skill that he just hasn't been able to master yet. I think it's sensory overload and bikes in the size he would need, they don't have training wheels. This bike is perfect for him! He can balance on it, put his toys or stuffed animals in the basket, and most importantly, he loves it! The instructions to put it together were a little complicated, but all in all, it's awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Be aware!  Multiple, essential parts were missing! Quality Control is clearly not a priority.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a Christmas gift for my Mother-in-law in Indiana. Because of the weather, they did not start to assemble it until now (mid March). It is a nice tricycle but... It is missing 1) the seat post 2) the nuts to hold the wheels on, and 3) the pedals. Quality Control, by this company is a best VERY questionable. This is very annoying on a product with this price point. Now I’m going to have to scramble to see if I can find the needed parts, just so the bike can work for the very first time. I would not recommend buying anything from this retailer.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald Hill

customer_reviews.title: VERY DIFFICULT TO RIDE, especially for the elderly, boarding on dangerous
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for an elderly friend, hoping it would make him safer on the road than his two wheel bike but no, it is actually surprisingly difficult to pedal! He struggled with it, then one of us went to show him how and we had difficulty with it. I read about this in some of the reviews, but chose to overlook it, which was my mistake. I actually think this bike is dangerous for an elderly person.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Noonan

customer_reviews.title: I purchased this bike to get back and forth to ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this bike to get back and forth to work, nd it has become a whole new project I am converting it to an E-bike! I purchased (Add-On Motorize Bike 48v 1000w 26-Inch Front Wheel Electric Bicycle Motor Conversion Kit) and (48V 3A automatic e-bike, scooter & vehicle battery charger) as the charger. (12V 22Ah Baoshi 6-DZM-20 6DZM20 Scooter Bike Sealed Battery - 4 Pack - Mighty Max Battery brand product) for the batteries. I am now just waiting on the batteries. I will update if everything works out or not.
customer_reviews.author: Jorge Acosta

customer_reviews.title: Easy to put together if you follow the instructions roughly ...
customer_reviews.text: This was a birthday gift for my 65 year old mother. It was delivered in under 24hrs . Easy to put together if you follow the instructions roughly 1 hr . The fenders as expected are a little flimsy but the bike is very solid. My mother was so excited to ride her bike with her grandkids without the fear of falling off a regular two wheeled bike now that she is getting older. She absolutely loves it . Going up small hills is not a challlange at all . Well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: hlmp

customer_reviews.title: LOVELY BIKE! BUT PRE DAMAGED !:(
customer_reviews.text: An accident left me unable to ride a standard bike at that time, this would have been perfect to hang out with the kids. We were soo excited when it arrived that we immediately took it to the nearest bike shop for assembly. Only 10min later shop calls me back to look at my damaged, scratched purchase (out of the box) and told me it could not be assembled properly due to damage.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I give it 5 stars because I'm very pleased with my purchase
customer_reviews.text: I give it 5 stars because I'm very pleased with my purchase .When I read the reviews I was puzzled at how many customers mentioned the tires rubbing the fenders. I received mine in the box & then put it together which wasn't very difficult.little bit tricky to connect rear axle frame evenly but just used 2 chairs. Replaced the screws to shorter ones. Pedals wonderfully & coasts very well.The instructions say to lightly grease the front steering column when putting together handle bars to frame,but just a light film of it. As far as myself I'm gonna love taking trips to the grocery store or just going to the park for a picnic.
customer_reviews.author: Hall.Terry82

customer_reviews.title: wife loves it
customer_reviews.text: wife loves the bike / wife suffers from MS and has balancing problems from it., so she can no longer ride a regular two wheel bike so once we adjusted the seat and handle bars on the trike she gets around in it good. the single gear is not hard to pedal at all. Just a little hard going up a hill
customer_reviews.author: Lisa W

customer_reviews.title: packaging is poor, every element on this bike is CHEEP CHEEP ...
customer_reviews.text: OMG...As the man was taking the box off his truck, parts were falling out of the box!!!! We had to look back in the truck to see if anything was there. Front fender was dented, the two back fenders were bent, front tire would not take air...I now how to go and find a bicycle shop for repair. YOU GET WHAT YOU PAY FOR...my mother always said. $300. for an Adult Tricycle is not a lot of money...quality is shoddy, packaging is poor, every element on this bike is CHEEP CHEEP CHEEP! Just because Shwinn is on the bike, does not make it a good bike. Save up for a better quality bike.
customer_reviews.author: DIANE

customer_reviews.title: Poor Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: I have contacted Schwinn twice via their customer service on-line. Right after assembling my bike there was a persistent clicking noise. I took it to a bike repair person thinking I had done something wrong. I was told the problem was a factory defect that he has seen a couple of times on the bike. He suggested I contact the company for a replacement part as it was not something he could fix. I have written twice and have not had any contact other than a note telling me they received my message. This has been going on since April. No contact, no customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Atkinson

customer_reviews.title: Schwinn Meridian  26 inch adult tricycle
customer_reviews.text: Frame is built like a tank. Relatively easy to assemble. Mostly metric tools are required. Tensioning the rear drive train can be done by one person and isn't as complicated as some would have you believe. Comfortable rider with a fat cruiser saddle. Single speed and street tires limits your ride pretty much to bike paths and improved surfaces. Arrived by UPS with no issues. No missing parts, no damaged or marred parts. I'd buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: ERNEST TURNAGE

customer_reviews.title: Nice, few bolts missing...but pretty good value.
customer_reviews.text: The tricycle is just the right size for this 60 something, short woman. It arrived in a box and nothing dented or damaged. While it did take my hubby a couple days to put it together, he did find that some of the holes did not line up correctly and there were a few bolts missing, but nothing he couldn't fix with a run to the hardware store. I'm a little under 5'2", so we have lowered the seat and handle bars to accommodate my short stature. I love the 'trike' and my Grandchildren tease me, but I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Anne

customer_reviews.title: ... sure to follow assembly instructions and it is not bad to put together
customer_reviews.text: Be sure to follow assembly instructions and it is not bad to put together. I am 68 yrs old and this bike is easy to ride. Fun to ride too. I went from a 21 speed 2 wheel and was concerned if I would be able to peddle this bike. The biggest issue was the strength in my legs but once I got the hang of it, it was surprisingly easy to peddle. I put *wheel bright on all my wheels. Coolest thing in the park.
customer_reviews.author: countrygirlNOLA

customer_reviews.title: I like my trycycle a lot I thought it was going ...
customer_reviews.text: I like my trycycle a lot I thought it was going to be blue but actually looks grey. I like the powder puff blue color. I have to get used to it. It's a little intimidating for me I haven't been on a bike in a long time. It took me 3 days to put it together. I'm a 67 years old woman but I put it together. I like my bike .I wish it was blue 😆
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice bike bad packaging
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable & attractive. Took my husband appx 2 hours to assemble using his own tools. The reason for only 4 stars is the box arrived beat up and there were dents and scratches on the bike. During quarantine bikes are hard to find so we did not return it. If I was going to buy another trike I'd get multi-speeds or electric backup motor. This bike is very difficult on inclines and impossible on hills. My 135 lb body does not have the strength for hills. Downhill curves are a bit of a challenge for someone used to a multi-speed regular bike. Getting used to 2 tires in back has a learning curve but not difficult.
customer_reviews.author: Blanca L-J

customer_reviews.title: Assembly takes a while, but worth it!
customer_reviews.text: Assembly for someone who knows little about bikes (me) takes a while but in the end the bike is fantastic! My wife absolutely loves it! Very smooth ride and easy to mount and dismount, even for a shorter person (she's 5'3") Had problems adjusting the brakes, but a quick visit to Youtube and I learned how to properly do it! Packaging could be better, but not horrible.
customer_reviews.author: K. C. Herrera

customer_reviews.title: I purchased the bike in March 2018 but haven't had ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the bike in March 2018 but haven't had a chance to ride it yet. Winter refuses to let go this year. I assembled the bike over the holiday weekend and discovered two dents in the left back fender. Also, the connection hardware for the back wheel had been installed on the front wheel (presumably at the factory). Although the wheels are the same size, the back wheels have different hubs compared to the front (so the wheels are not interchangeable). I don't assemble bicycles for a living, so it took awhile before I figured out why nothing was fitting the way it should.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha

customer_reviews.title: Working
customer_reviews.text: After finally getting after arriving at the shop to be assembled damaged it is workin nicely. I am a short person and have to lean forward to reach the handle bars. The shop said the back brakes are made with piece of leather which I guess is old technology. I didn’t put it together so I didn’t see the brakes. It is easy to pedal and lighter feeling than I thought it would be. The fenders don’t appear to cover the whole width of the rear tires, which may be a problem if caught in the rain. I love the color.
customer_reviews.author: Missy

customer_reviews.title: The tricycle allows me to ride with a better sense of security
customer_reviews.text: I am older and wanted a bike to get some exercise by riding a bike. I was worried about the possibility of falling due to balance issues. The tricycle allows me to ride with a better sense of security. We take it with us when we travel in our RV and I use it to get around the RV Parks when we are traveling. My husband put it together with a minimum effort. Now, I am trying to get my dog to walk along with he while I ride so we both get some exercise and when he gets tired, I put him in the basket. He's not quite sure about that yet.
customer_reviews.author: BETHANY HOWARD

customer_reviews.title: Best ,safe outside exercise Adult trycycle.
customer_reviews.text: My granddaughter never learned to ride a bike . Now she is concerned about falling. I saw this on Amazon and thought it would be a great Christmas gift. She is so proud of her adult trycycle. No worries of falling. Large basket in back. I want one. Instructions on assembly are as should be, I mean easy to read and detailed. Exercise and fun at same time. I recommend this for bike riders that have difficulty balancing, getting older really don't need to fall ,this is an answer to safe,fun, outside exercise.
customer_reviews.author: Evelyn J.

customer_reviews.title: beautiful, stylish and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: this arrived earlier than expected and only 2 days after it was shipped. my husband spent about a day with frequent breaks putting it together. I'm looking forward to being able to schlep groceries in the big cargo basket. I haven't ridden my regular bike for fear of falling but with this I can ride with confidence and get some exercise. I was an avid bicyclist for decades but as one ultimately ages things change I'm back on the road again with the trike.
customer_reviews.author: Clodagh

customer_reviews.title: ZERO customer Support
customer_reviews.text: Schwinn doesn't answer the customer service phone number provided in the instruction manual nor customer service requests submitted on their website. If you have an assembly question, you are on your own. I'm an engineer and am pretty good at assembling various products. I'm not experienced with bikes and ran into an issue not covered in the assembly instructions or YouTube videos. One phone call could have resolved this issue, but my experience with this purchase is that Schwinn doesn't actually offer support, despite their publishing a support phone number. Not one phone call or online customer service request has been answered during the last 3 weeks.
customer_reviews.author: K. N.

customer_reviews.title: Buyers be ware. Never buy this product.
customer_reviews.text: First the bolts were not aligning up while we were putting the bike together. Then as we were putting air in the tire the tube blew up in my husbands face ruining the rim. This is the worst Schwinn bike I've ever purchased. Sending this product back!!
customer_reviews.author: Ernie & Selena

customer_reviews.title: Great bicycle, looks good and is well made!
customer_reviews.text: Took me about an hour and a half to assemble. It was well packed, there were no parts missing, and it was really just installing the rear axle assembly, tires, fenders, seat, adjusting everything and getting the riding position adjusted properly. The instructions were precise, and easy to follow. Schwinn also has a link on Amazon for the assembly as well. I did watch that prior to ordering the bike. If you have put a swing set together this is as easy. You must follow the directions. I’m very happy with this trike and would highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: M. Corrigan

customer_reviews.title: I love my bike even though it has a few flaws ...
customer_reviews.text: I love my bike even though it has a few flaws I did have to send it back once and then it was still missing some parts that had to be sent again and I am a shorter person so the seat has to be set down low and it rubs on the back basket so I have two tears on the seat and even though I keep it out of the elements most of the time the back basket seems to be fading and it does have rust in some spots so I am somewhat disappointed for the amount of money that I did spend on the bike
customer_reviews.author: Callie Puehler

customer_reviews.title: I can't ride it
customer_reviews.text: This is a beautiful tricycle but it is not usable. I had to wait for a neighbor to return from vacation to assemble it and now that he did I can't use it. The placement of the pedals makes it impossible for me to use. They are so far back it makes the rider's motion straight up in down like a unicycle but there isn't the room for a full stretch. I never thought that I would have this trouble but here I am with a beautiful $320.00 tricycle that I can't return. Caution everyone. Find a tricycle that you can ride before you buy.
customer_reviews.author: AgnesMooney

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE THIS BIKE!!! I bought it to take to the NASCAR races, we camp in the infield, its just perfect for cruising the huge infield, I just added a cute white wicker basket on the front adorned with some red rose buds, viola! It's all dolled up and ready to roll! She rides like a dream and my cup holder fits great in the basket, cooler in the rear basket, she is all set for concerts and party time at the NASCAR races!!! Easy assembly, great price, super fast shipping and quality you expect from the Schwinn bike! Dont settle for anything less! LOVE IT ! <3
customer_reviews.author: Tawny L. Stoddard

customer_reviews.title: Difficult assembly.
customer_reviews.text: It’s taken almost three hours to assemble by a very handy person! Also, hint....the seat post is INSIDE the frame and needs to be pulled out and then secured for seat attachment. More to follow when I can actually ride it. Pretty color. Update: I’m changing my rating because after the difficult assembly, the bike rides easily and is fun. It does take a while to transition from a two to three wheeler due to entirely different body mechanics, steering and camber. Also, it’s very heavy. The only regret I have now is I wanted a red one and it wasn’t available!!
customer_reviews.author: Brooklyn Doc

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I am absolutely loving this tricycle! I'm 40 years old. I never learned how to ride a bike. I've tried several times over the years, but never could get the balance. Now I ride this, and it's such an amazing feeling! I'm so happy I made this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Obsessed!
customer_reviews.text: Ok so there are some down sides to this bike. First off the tire went flat after the first use so I had to replace the inner tube then it is also very squeaky and some parts feel a little flimsy. That being said I am OBSESSED with this tricycle! I literally ride it everywhere around town to run my errands. The cart is so convenient and the 24" height is perfect for me being under 5ft tall. I hadn't rode a bike in years and now I am excited to go for a bike ride every time my daughter asks. Wish I would have bought this years ago!
customer_reviews.author: Mr. & Mrs. Pucciarelli

customer_reviews.title: SOUNDS LIKE A TIN CAN - SEAT LIKE A BRICK - DENTED AND SCRATCHED
customer_reviews.text: Was very excited to get this bike. Husband put it together...not all that hard. Unfortunately, it already had several scratches and a dented fender. I still kept it as they are very hard to come by. When I started to ride it made a horrible clanging noise. Chains were fine. It appears to be something with the axel that is internal and cannot be adjusted. We watched YouTube videos of people with the same issue. People turn and stare from a block away when we are coming down the street to hear what the heck the noise is. Seat is like a brick. Overall...it's just ok. A lot of money for just ok. The quality IS NOT there.
customer_reviews.author: funathome

customer_reviews.title: Old lady loves this bike!
customer_reviews.text: Love this bike! So happy I bought it for my mom (she’s 65)! Got her out of the house and riding in a time that we are all stuck mostly inside at home. Bike was a bit tricky to put together but with the help of a YouTube video we got it together in no time. (Like 2 1/2 hours). Rides great! I’m sad that they seem to be sold out or extremely overpriced now because I would LOVE to have one too!
customer_reviews.author: Amyth4

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable & sturdy bike
customer_reviews.text: Firstly, I gave 5 stars for assembly as my friends boyfriend put it together. It took him a little over an hour. There’s was no way I could have done this on my own. Secondly, the bike is comfortable to ride, especially the seat. I have an ample bum, this was a concern for me. Lastly, the instructions were spot on, according to my friends boyfriend. I’ve only ridden the bike a few times as I’ve been so busy. I’m going to have to invest in a low rider, so I may take the bike to various places. Keep this in mind when purchasing a trike. Definitely happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Karen D

customer_reviews.title: Not for me.
customer_reviews.text: The bike came with a badly dented rear fender and a front fender. Also bike seem to be kinda wobbly not very sturdy. I would say you'll get what you pay for a cheap bike.
customer_reviews.author: Gary D Jensen

customer_reviews.title: For even minimum hills, buy a 3-speed adult tricycle.
customer_reviews.text: What a beautiful bicycle for seniors...sturdy, easy to ride, excellent balance! My husband assembled it with the additional help of a YouTube instructional presentation in one afternoon. Although this was an Amazon "damaged carton" bargain, it was in perfect condition aside from three easily restored little dents in the fenders. It is now perfect! But, discovered for biking on hilly surfaces, order a 3 speed adult trike!
customer_reviews.author: BJOregon

customer_reviews.title: Son LOVES it!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have a 19 year old son with autism. He hasn’t been able to ride a bike since he fit on a child tricycle. He LOVES this bike. It’s easy for him to pedal and maneuver around. He wants to go on bike rides everyday. He’s not very outdoorsy so this bike has been getting him outside. I love it too. It was a PAIN to put together, though. That was the only downfall.
customer_reviews.author: cmaldo03

customer_reviews.title: Excellent buy for the money. Sold bike.
customer_reviews.text: Assembly takes time. Easier with two people. Try to put the fenders on before you put on the wheels. Infinitely easier. Alignment of the rear two wheel section is crucial. Bike is in two separate parts. Not easy to install secondary small chain - master link is very difficult to snap on. If you have been used to a two wheel bike, a trike takes some time and patience to master. Different feel, turning is completely from a two wheeler. Bike is heavy. Nice feature is that you lock both brakes to make them act like parking brake. Assembly instruction/owner's manual is very well hidden. Find it in the flat box that holds the basket.
customer_reviews.author: Anders

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful but Slightly Defective
customer_reviews.text: After my son and I assembled the tricycle and pumped up the tires over the Thanksgiving week, I took the trike for a ride and heard a clicking noise...a metal-on-metal noise coming from the right rear wheel area. We checked the fender...nope, checked the basket...nope. My son left for home and I then asked my handyman to look into it. He diagnosed a damaged ball bearing in the back axel. With his help I took the trike to a local TREK shop (no Schwin dealers here) and they diagnosed an assembly-line error that resulted in a damaged ball bearing. They are ordering one and will help fix the bike.
customer_reviews.author: Qbear

customer_reviews.title: Great for people with balance issues but very heavy
customer_reviews.text: Great trike if you have balance issues. Sturdy, attractive design and colors. My teenage girl with CP loves the independence it gives her. On the flip side, it is somewhat difficult to assemble, it is very heavy and bulky and it is quite hard to pedal uphill. Turning takes some extra space and practice. We added pedal straps to keep feet on the pedals, a snazzy unicorn bell and a night light. Overall pretty happy with the quality and functionality. The price is awesome compared to all special needs tricycles out there.
customer_reviews.author: Bargain Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Pretty but don’t do it!
customer_reviews.text: It’s pretty, but the seat is horribly uncomfortable and the whole thing feels like I’m riding a toy. It rattles and the fenders scrape no matter how you bend and mount them. I had such high hopes to be a leisurely cruiser,, I’m just uncomfortable and unable to hardly pedal out of a driveway because the bike hates the tiniest drop-off.
customer_reviews.author: Terri Hase

customer_reviews.title: Great bike!
customer_reviews.text: Update back to five stars - Schwinn stood by their bike and sent me a replacement part. Thank you Schwinn! Love the bike but I was sent a faulty bike. I took it to a bike shop to have assembled and assembly that holds the chain was welded off center and my bike is a dud. I’m waiting to hear back from Schwinn to see if they are going to replace the faulty parts. The bike itself is fabulous but I was sent a broken bike. Don’t do what I did and let the bike sit in the box for a year .
customer_reviews.author: AzaleaMist

customer_reviews.title: it's great!
customer_reviews.text: I had a stroke a few years ago. I feel very safe on this bike. I had trouble with the shipping, the company worked very hard to get me the bike .If you have had an injury in your life get this bike! It's great! Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: t

customer_reviews.title: I would buy this trike again from the same dealer, OJCommerce.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this trike for my wife’s birthday early may 2020. We waited about a month for delivery. The packaging was perfect and no damage to any part of this trike. I was worried about this fact as I have read other trike reviews. This trike went together with no problems. My wife has rode this trike for first time in 30 years and was pleased. Schwann makes a very good trike as compared to other brands I have compared to for the price range. We love the color but wished Schwann would offer other colors for this model s4025.
customer_reviews.author: David Newell

customer_reviews.title: OK bike - If getting for older person look for foot breaks.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my mother-in-law for a combo gift - Mother's day and her birthday. She has a bike in Florida and she likes to ride there. The one in Florida has foot breaks and this one is a hand break which is a bit harder for her to use. Also there was an issue with the metal fenders, like others had reported they were bent down towards the tire and felt flimsy. It's Ok - she is not riding it much.
customer_reviews.author: Mama T

customer_reviews.title: There was NO instruction manual included with the trike!!
customer_reviews.text: The trike was delivered today. I didn't use the trike at all - I returned it. I didn't know to put it together because Schwinn did not put any instructions in the box!!! I am not going to waste my time looking online for the manual - that is Schwinn's responsibility!! DO NOT EVER ORDER ANYTHING FROM SCHWINN!!!!! They obviously do not give a damn about quality!! Here is an update: When packing the trike up for return, I realized that the box did NOT have ANY bolts, nuts, etc included. So how could I have put the thing together even if they HAD included the manual???
customer_reviews.author: Robert Sherman

customer_reviews.title: Chain falls off after month of owning
customer_reviews.text: At first glance, this trike seemed to have all the bells and whistles. About a month later and 10 miles of riding done, the gears/shifting mechanism can't seem to keep the chain on. The design is flawed and the chain falls off every time you up shift or downshift. The handlebars are already showing signs of corrosion and its kept in a climate controlled garage. For the price, I would've expected these problems way down the line. Not a month after purchase. Disappointed to say the least.
customer_reviews.author: Zach

customer_reviews.title: Great bike!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this bike for my 10 year old who has struggled to learn to ride a 2 wheel bike and was losing confidence. This bike has been amazing and after one day has given her so much more confidence and happiness to be able to ride on her own bike! Even though this is an adult bike it is comfortable for kids. My 7 year old is even able to ride it with the seat all the way down. No matter your age, this bike is a win in my opinion. Also, it was pretty easy to put together.
customer_reviews.author: Shari

customer_reviews.title: I like the trike just fine
customer_reviews.text: So far, I like the trike just fine. I might have liked a 3 speed better, but happy with the single speed. However, when I received the trike the box was in terrible condition. It was wet and torn. Much of the hardware was strewn around the box. I had to find two washers from my supply that fit. Eventually found the 2 washers when I broke to carton down for disposal.
customer_reviews.author: Ang

customer_reviews.title: Arrived with bent or damaged rear axle
customer_reviews.text: My trike arrived without apparent damage, but upon assembly the rear end makes a clunking sound. We spoke to a bike shop the said this is usually a bad bearing or bent rear axle. Have been trying g to contact Pacific cycle as shop recommended. Could not get through on phone so left email. They responded by saying they were looki g into it . This has been 2 weeks ago and still no one has contacted us. Very disapointed. Have not decided whether to take it to be fixed or send it back.
customer_reviews.author: Tigerlily

customer_reviews.title: Love this trike
customer_reviews.text: Love this trike. Works well and stable for me to ride while exercising my 86 lb Lab. I was never a great bike rider while young and this is working well for me at age 72. Only way I was ever going to keep up with this young dog. The weight of the bike hasn't been a problem. Only slight problem other than exchanging a bent wheel and rim - is I have to keep after the alignment of the fenders as it is very close to the tires. I hear it as soon as it gets out of alignment.
customer_reviews.author: MG

customer_reviews.title: Chain and handlebars break easy
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this trike in 2016 for my grandson who is autistic. The trike worked fine until the rear chain broke (several times and we've had ot repaired at a bicycle shop) . Also the handlebars snapped and we had those replaced. It saddens us that this bicycle didn't hold up past 4 years (it's only used in spring & summer). Originally we choose to buy swinn because of its quality of merchandise . Unfortunately, this is not the case with this particular bike. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie obara

customer_reviews.title: Great senior bike.
customer_reviews.text: Box came pretty beat up, but no damage to product. Used YouTube video. Little bit difficult to align. Great bike for senior.
customer_reviews.author: Francullo

customer_reviews.title: Schwinn Meridian Adult 26-Inch 3-Wheel Bike
customer_reviews.text: I bought this Schwinn Meridian Adult 26-Inch 3-Wheel Bike for me as I am now 61 years old and used to love riding my bicycle but am afraid of my balance.I am also agoraphobic from a work accident and this is an activity that gets me out of the house verses going to a gym.My pit goes witj me and it is perfect.I would recommend
customer_reviews.author: Psych RN

customer_reviews.title: For someone that never learned to ride
customer_reviews.text: My husband helped me assemble the bicycle. He's assembled many bicycle before and is very knowledgeable. If you follow the directions some of the steps are more difficult than if you already know what you're doing. We were able to put it together quickly but we didn't follow the steps in the order from the manual. Other than that, it's super sturdy and very sharp. It's easy to ride. I'm 6 ft and it was comfortable. I was able to quickly get on and ride.
customer_reviews.author: NJSC Coquis

customer_reviews.title: Building your Schwinn trike...
customer_reviews.text: Following the directions made the assembly fairly straight forward. If you follow the directions in order, the bike will go together smoothly, before you know it ! Pay special attention to the brakes. These are a little tricky to adjust, if you have never done it before. Otherwise, this is a quality bike, and will give you years of enjoyment !
customer_reviews.author: Con G.

customer_reviews.title: Its a little bit of a challenge to build but its nice
customer_reviews.text: I don't think I will every buy a bike online again. Its a little bit of a challenge to build and when i called the bike shops in town they don't want to tune it up for less than $100.00. As soon as they figure out I got it online they want to charge me an assembly fee plus the tune up but if you are good with tools its a very nice bike. It probably deserves a 5 rating if I didn't run into this same problem but I honestly wanted you to read this in case you don't think you can build it....so you wont be stuck like me. The bike is really nice though.
customer_reviews.author: M. Ruiz

customer_reviews.title: Great...EXCEPT!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is almost the perfect vehicle...except...the rear fenders have to be the cheapest shoddiest pieces of trash ever to grace a piece of equipment. It is almost impossible to adjust them away from the tires. I bought two of these trikes and am happy to have them, but I may have to remove the fenders and put up with the water/mud on my back rather than fight with them.
customer_reviews.author: Marysdude

customer_reviews.title: Maybe look at other options before purchasing this item
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item for my mom who wanted a trike and I bough this item so she could go to the beach and take a bike ride. This item is kind of heavy compared to other bikes I own. It was pretty difficult to build I left out the fenders because they cam bent and were way to difficult to try to get them on. I was pretty happy when I built this item until I came to notice that the bike seat came torn and at that point it was too late to return because the bike was already built at it would have been so much trouble to return considering it’s a huge box.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny

customer_reviews.title: Works well.
customer_reviews.text: It's a little hard to assemble, and jingle jangles a bit with the tire guards, but is otherwise solid. Supports me, over 300lbs right now, though I did replace the seat and post with something better. The default seat wouldn't tighten enough to not rotate on me. One tire did arrive flat, and on inflation burst at low pressure. The first replacement behaved identically, so I presume this is an issue with Schwinn Tubes(which are slightly offsize from standard). The third tube has been fine at ~40PSI, since the other two both burst at ~50, even though the tire indicates it should be able to go up to 65.
customer_reviews.author: Bob T

customer_reviews.title: Great quality bike !
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my grandsons11th birthday . He has autism and found a reg bike impossible to ride. This has given him the freedom to ride bikes with his brother and sister plus they use his basket to haul all their stuff they want to bring when they take a ride to grandmas house !
customer_reviews.author: Mary Kinney-Henderson

customer_reviews.title: Good product for the price.
customer_reviews.text: For the price, you can't beat it. Ordered for my physically/mentally challenged sister-in-law. She can no longer balance on a regular bike. The basket is great for her to go shopping downtown. No gears to frustrate her. Just a simple old-fashioned bike with an extra wheel. The color is a silvery blue, prettier than the photo. Fenders don't have much clearance in the front as if the supports are the wrong length.
customer_reviews.author: Lily R

customer_reviews.title: Son loves it! It came in damaged.
customer_reviews.text: We bought this bike for our 11 year old son with disabilities. He loves the bike. One of the fenders came in with a dent of substantial size but the box was in perfect shape. It must have happened at the manufacturer and they stuck it in the box damaged anyway. It wasn't worth the time to go through the return process, but if you pay this much for a bike, you don't expect such a careless effort from the manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: Leighton Allen

customer_reviews.title: Exceptional Bicycle!!
customer_reviews.text: I've been in the market for about 10 years for a 3-wheeler. Found this at the local Academy store and fell in love. Price is great, it looks great, it rides great - I haven't enjoyed a bike this much since I got my first Schwinn in the early 60's. It fits in the back of my PT Cruiser. Might be a bit challenging to carry in a lot of passenger cars. If you're in the market for a sturdy, affordable 3-wheeler bicycle with a long heritage of quality craftsmanship, you can't do much better than the Schwinn Meridian!
customer_reviews.author: Peyton

customer_reviews.title: poor construction - incorrect welding
customer_reviews.text: Wow - so disappointed. The bike was packaged well - but - the front fork was pre-attached/welded to the head tube backwards! The brake wires were already set up so it isn't a matter of simply figuring out how to rotate the fork. There is even a sticker on the fork that states which side is 'rear'! I don't know where we're going to go from here because I do not want to have to take this to a bike shop to be reassembled and I'm not sure even a pro could fix this mess. I'm seriously thinking of returning this and trying something different.
customer_reviews.author: Coffee gal

customer_reviews.title: Good price, but flimsy, can feel the frame bend when simply steering, and the rear axle makes ticking noises when in motion.
customer_reviews.text: It's flimsy, it bends easily, and it makes ticking noises while peddling or letting it coast (basically any time it's moving) that comes from the rear axle. I paid $150 to have this trike assembled professionally, so it wasn't an issue of my putting it together wrong. But just the act of steering it while riding, I could feel the bike frame bending. It was a good price, but the quality was garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Kizzume Fowler

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the hassle!!
customer_reviews.text: Wow. I have had to call customer service twice now for parts that were broke or bent. My husband called for a new axel and just got it yesterday and it's bent too! Got this bike for my mother and the rate we are going it will be winter and she won't be able to ride it!
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Harrison

customer_reviews.title: Might be a good bike if I can get it tomorrow.
customer_reviews.text: Very difficult to put together. In some places manufactured parts are all but welded on. Two calls to customer service went nowhere. First call I was supposed to get a call back. That was yesterday. Still waiting. Today spoke to customer service. Couldn’t wait for me to get off the phone even though it took me a while to get through. I was told that she sent me an email with assembly info and where to reach out to if I still had a problem. That was about 4 and a half hours ago. Still no email that was supposedly sent at 4:30 pm. I’ll give it one more shot and then back it goes.
customer_reviews.author: Gene

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.text: I had this trike professionally assembled. There were so many parts it was daunting. After I had ridden it a few times the back end started clicking. It progressively got louder. I took it back to the shop where I had it assembled. They tuned it up but told me there was nothing they could do about the clicking. Schwinn is no longer a company. Other companies buy the right to use the Schwinn name but build cheap immitations, which is apparently what I purchased, a cheap Schwinn immitation. Don't waste your money on this trike.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: DAMAGED!
customer_reviews.text: Everything was okay till I grabbed the fenders. They were dented and damaged. Not sure if I was tossed around while being delievered or tossed around in the factory. Not satisfied with my buy at all.
customer_reviews.author: Oskar Carpio

customer_reviews.title: Not the easiest thing to assemble
customer_reviews.text: As someone familiar with drafting, I felt that the instructions could have been a little bit more clear. Once I assembled the first half of the unit, the rest was a breeze. It was for my mom- she loves it and rides it everywhere. And you can get a Margaritaville Parrot Horn for $7 (from amazon)- she insisted. 😂
customer_reviews.author: Ben Willocks

customer_reviews.title: Cute trike, fun to ride, but be prepared to need more tools and knowledge
customer_reviews.text: I was really excited about getting this trike and it wasn't too difficult to put together. The instructions were okay, but I had to watch some YouTube videos to figure out how to get the front brakes to work correctly. Rode the trike for less than 15 miles and started hearing a knocking sound coming from the back end. Emailed Pacific Cycle and was told to remove both back wheels and try tapping on the axle with a rubber mallet because the bearings may have tipped. That didn't work, so now they're sending me new bearings. I guess it's a good thing I'm mechanically inclined and YouTube exists!
customer_reviews.author: tequilabunny

customer_reviews.title: Mismatch between actual parts and instructions
customer_reviews.text: Wouldn't it be nice if the parts matched the instructions. The actual parts weren't an exact match with either the (out of date?) printed instructions or the online video. Eventually, I was able to complete assembly; however, since I still don't know the exact assembly instructions, I will never know if the tricycle was assembled perfectly (safely?). My assumption is that minor changes are made to design/parts over time and the company is too lazy to update the old instructions - assuming the that the buyer can figure it out.
customer_reviews.author: Falcon

customer_reviews.title: Defective and no way to get replacement part
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this bike directly from amazon.com but we didn't put it together right away, because of weather and the season. Now we are trying to put it together and the back axle is bent and we've tried everything to get it to straighten. Since we are over 30 days (8 days past) we have no way of contacting Amazon to get a replacement part. I'm sure the bike will be great, but trying to contact Amazon is impossible. Now i think we are out $320!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great adult trike, you can’t lose with a Schwinn product!
customer_reviews.text: The basket rattled a lot which is annoying. I may put something between the fender and the basket to remedy that. Smooth ride. I had Scheels put it together for $70,?well worth it. I purchased a Schwinns comfort seat without the back , still need to place it on the trike. Love the color, it’s more of a silvery blue than slate blue as stated. After first ride noticed front tire flat and can’t be pumped or repaired! Need new one!
customer_reviews.author: Roxanne Seys

customer_reviews.title: It works great and is well built
customer_reviews.text: The only downside to this (if it is a downside) is that it is a bit heavy without changeable gears. It works great and is well built, but starting from a stop can be tedious. The bike looks good and the basket holds a ton of weight if needed. *edit April 2019* I upgraded this with a 500w electric front tire and 3x12ah sealed lead acid batteries for disabled wife to cruise around on (total of about $280). She loves it and can now go over 20 miles on a charge with intermittent peddling. The rear rims need rebuilt, not the sturdiest built, but overall still extremely happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: James Antikythera

customer_reviews.title: Bent Axle
customer_reviews.text: After assembly, I realized that the right rear axle is bent and causing a strong wobble in the wheel. I do not believe this is shipping related, as the item was well protected in its packaging. At this point, after completing the assembly, it's more trouble to disassemble, repackage, and return. Guess I'll have to find some way to press that axle straight. Otherwise, product quality seems decent, and assembly instructions are very detailed.
customer_reviews.author: JuleiTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Dog can run faster than you can pedal
customer_reviews.text: I bought this tricycle to take my 45lb dog out for runs/walks using a WalkyDog. I got this instead of a normal 2 wheeled bicycle since I have an irrational fear of them. The tricycle works great and is a smooth ride. Brakes work just fine, however I feel like I need to adjust the front brake a bit. My only complaint is that there is only one speed, and quite frankly when my dog gets to a full on sprint (she loves to run...), she can pull my 130lb-self faster than you can when pedaling. So that's always an exciting experience. Otherwise the trike has been great.
customer_reviews.author: Virginia

customer_reviews.title: Broken light and dented fender - box damaged
customer_reviews.text: The first bike has a bent frame. I destroyed the box before bike put together. Now I have to go buy a box. This is second bike with broken light and dented fender- box damaged. WHAT IS THE DEAL WITH TWO BIKES BEING DEFECTIVE? I want someone to email or call me.
customer_reviews.author: Cake baker

customer_reviews.title: Don't expect much and you won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: Whatever you do don't buy this piece of junk. You will ride a quarter of a mile then come back home for two days of adjustment to try and get the grinding noise out. It won't happen. Pacific Cycle is useless to help with problems. Packaging is impossible to save in order to return. Never buy a bike or trike online. You were warned.
customer_reviews.author: ALF

customer_reviews.title: SchWIN 3 wheeler
customer_reviews.text: the front fender rubs when driving We took it off one of the back tires does not hold air we may have to buy another Frame looks strong other than those items it went together fine we ended up buying a new innertube because there was a tear in the original tube
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Overall, the bike is acceptable, however the assembly ...
customer_reviews.text: Overall, the bike is acceptable, however the assembly presented more problems than I expected from a product with the Schwinn name attached. Also, there is a noticeable intermittent noise/sound coming from the rear part of the bike that I have not been able to locate, or eliminate. I have removed and adjusted the rear fender brackets several times and that does not stop the noise. I have also adjusted the brake pads several times. I am wondering if it is not caused by the rear brake mechanism but have not had the time to look at that part as yet. Any help would be appreciated.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed in the Quality
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for my mother-in-law. Arrived with several scratches. Didn't bother putting in a claim because I didn't want to deal with it. Also, the hardware package shipped inside had busted open in shipping and scattered throughout the box. Sloppy packaging. I would recommend paying a bit more and purchasing from a local bike shop.
customer_reviews.author: Christian Erno

customer_reviews.title: Our daughter loves it!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this tricycle for our daughter who has a brain injury which causes her to have problems with balance. She loves her tricycle! My husband had some trouble putting it together; it took a couple of days. It looks very nice and now I'm thinking about getting one for myself.
customer_reviews.author: C. Heizer

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful Bike
customer_reviews.text: It's a beautiful bike -- Took 4 hours to put together -- One fender was dented and instead of just sending that part they sent a whole new bike -- We would have been happy with a small credit for the damage but they cant do that -- The seat is hard and hurts after awhile so I would suggest a wide padded seat with a back rest
customer_reviews.author: Julie M

customer_reviews.title: Very good quality, easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: The box was damaged, but everything was okay except for a few minor scratches from parts rubbing togerther. I thought that I was missing a part, but the pipe that holds the seat had slid down in the frame. Took about 90 minutes to assemble the trike. I probably wasted 15 minutes trying to assemble and align the back axle. Maybe I should have read the directions. All in all, I am very satisfied with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Denyse Curtis

customer_reviews.title: Well built and looks quality
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bike for my mom but found myself riding it while I was visiting. Nice solid bike, huge basket and geared just right. assembly isnt too bad but give yourself a few hours and lots of space to lay things out. I assembled my moms in a 2 car garage and stuff everywhere! LOL. worth the effort for sure. My mom loves it
customer_reviews.author: ron

customer_reviews.title: It is SUPER heavy and bulky
customer_reviews.text: This is not a bike to get if you're planning on biking for more than a mile. It is SUPER heavy and bulky. Do not try to bike on an incline with this bike.
customer_reviews.author: Nikki

customer_reviews.title: Second one I have purchased with problems
customer_reviews.text: The first one I bought in 2013. There must have been a defect in the axle. After owning this bike 7 years no one would fix it even though it is a quality name Schwinn but made by China now. The newest one I bought as a replacement had a out of round front rim. The wheel wobbled and I had to take it to a bike repairman to not only assemble it but to straighten and repair the front rim. It was convenient to buy but I don't think I would do it again.
customer_reviews.author: William OBrien

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed in the lack of quality for a Schwinn
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to get this for my 80 year old mother. It is a Schwinn, so I thought I was getting great quality. I was disappointed. I'm not sure if my mother is going to be able to ride it very easily as it is a bit stiff. I think we can adjust it. The biggest issue is the really thin, cheap fenders. They keep rubbing the tires. We can get them bent on one end and then they start rubbing on the other. For Schwinn and $300 I was hoping for better than this.
customer_reviews.author: J. Ellis

customer_reviews.title: You get what you see.
customer_reviews.text: I can’t wait to ride it. My dad and daughter put the bike together, it did take a couple of hours. My dad is a pro at putting things together, I’m sure if I had to do it, it would take at least 4 hours. Its very sturdy, breaks work great, I can’t wait to take it for a longer ride. I just had knee surgery so it’s going to be a great way to get back to being active without the fear of falling.
customer_reviews.author: Rose Khatchatryan

customer_reviews.title: Can’t really complain too much for $300
customer_reviews.text: Bike needs to be assembled, no big deal. Directions missing but is self explanatory. The fenders had dents in it and some of the brake cable retaining clips were missing. All the parts required for assembly were there. Seat is pretty generic and not suited for long rides, not as low for short riders. Some minor defects in paint but hardly noticeable unless you are a few inches away and know to look for it.
customer_reviews.author: Eugene Lee

customer_reviews.title: Made in China with USA behind it!
customer_reviews.text: Trike components/parts are of poor quality. Bought two previously a number of years ago and LOVED them. They had thicker tires and frame work was of better quality. This new bike had parts missing and fenders were rubbing tires and overall quality was poor. Would like to return, but more trouble than worth! PLUS it took over two months to receive.
customer_reviews.author: barb

customer_reviews.title: WELL BUILT
customer_reviews.text: Well built, seem to ride fine, only hbad problem putting 1st**** missing smalls parts, 2 washers, i nut for seat 2nd*** Fenders had to be bent and adjusted to prevent rubbing on tires 3rd*** The direction, in booklet was not easy to follow, it tells you parts that isn't listed or in pics. ALL IN ALL ***** after getting some parts fromm shed, pulling out some gray hair, and getting to bed after midnight. we got it together, pump up all tires, and seem to be fine at this point.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the price!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my special needs daughter. My daughter is 18 yrs. old, 4ft 6in tall and weights 100lbs. We went with the 24 in wheels. This bike fits she wonderfully. She loves it. Her old bike was similar bike with 26” wheels. This one fits so much better. I looked at so many bike for her and I kept coming back to this model. It took me about an hour to put together. And then some fine tuning on the brakes. If your not handy with bikes get some help. Well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Harris

customer_reviews.title: very nice bike...
customer_reviews.text: all the Shwinns bikes ive ever owned have always been very nice and great quality and this one is no different...way better than cheap bikes that costs less...when I was assembling it I thought they had forgot to send the seat post so I contacted them by email and they promptly responded and told me to check down in the frame and there it was hiding in there...mine came with a bell and a mirror...
customer_reviews.author: cosmokramer

customer_reviews.title: FANTASTIC, I highly recommend this tricycle.
customer_reviews.text: I could not be more pleased with this purchase. I looked around everywhere for a good quality and reasonably priced tricycle, and took a gamble on this item. I'm happy to report this is a GREAT product. Since I hadn't put together a bike in over 2 decades, it took me a while to figure out how to put it together, but in retrospect, I just didn't interpret the assembly instructions correctly...they are clear and helpful. I HIGHLY recommend purchasing this item. Comes in one box with all needed parts...tire inflator not included.
customer_reviews.author: Cepeda

customer_reviews.title: Overall, a great trike.
customer_reviews.text: The tricycle is a decent high quality and comfortable to ride. My grandson put it together for me; he had issues with the some of the directions mainly because he is a novice when it comes to tools. A technical writer could improve the instructions with tool suggestions and a bit more detail when installing the post for the handle bar post and the fenders. I don't understand the reason for the soft rubber 1 1/2 inch tips on the ends of the handle bars; I prefer a solid handle. Nonetheless, it is easy to get on and off and it rides nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Leah Be

customer_reviews.title: I use it several times a week and really like it. Great customer service
customer_reviews.text: The rear end was really hard to put together, It wasn't welded properly. I've mechaniced for over 17 yrs, worked in a steel mill for over 5. It wasn't because of inexperience ! One of the tires broke threads and wouldn't stay on wheel. I called Schwinn on the tire and they sent me another one and told me not to use compressor. Used compressors for yrs and never blew one out until now. The bike is very well built other than the above statement. I use it several times a week and really like it. Great customer service!
customer_reviews.author: jonathan

customer_reviews.title: Good trike, rides good, came damaged
customer_reviews.text: This trike is for my wife, she likes it so far. It does ride different than a regular bike. She's getting used to that. It is easy to pedal and the brakes work well. The item arrived on time. The box was damaged and both rear fenders were damaged. I am going to see if I can get them to ship me new ones, if I can figure out how to contact them.
customer_reviews.author: TechBob

customer_reviews.title: Best bike out there folks!
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing bike..... i had someone put it together, though the quality of this mike is intense! No wonder it has a life time warranty... lots of enjoyable time...... great product!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Da Reviewer

product_meta.title: Schwinn Meridian Adult Tricycle, Three Wheel Cruiser Bike, Multiple Speeds and Electric, 26-Inch Wheel Trike, Cargo Basket, Adjustable Handlebars, Multiple Colors, Women Men
feature_bullets: Designed with 24-inch wheels, this bike fits riders ages 8 and up, or 4 feet 8 inches to 5 feet 6 inches tall
Single speed drivetrain is easy to use
Front linear pull brake and rear drum brake deliver reliable stopping power and both front and rear fenders help keep clothing clean in damp weather
Wide upright handlebars provide a stable, balanced ride, and the adjustable, padded cruiser saddle absorbs bumps
Super low, stand-over/step-through aluminum frame allows easy step-through access
